pull.title: cover DisconnectBlock with lock annotation
pull.body: While reviewing #23630, I noticed that `DisconnectBlock` is uncovered by lock annotations. CoinsTip() access requires cs_main and therefore so should this function.

events.message:
cover DisconnectBlock with lock annotation

CoinsTip() access requires cs_main and therefore so should this function.

events.body: Concept ACK on preventatively ensuring the mutex continues to be held over future changes when calling this function.

comments.body: This assertion in the definition seems unneeded? IIUC the lock annotation in the function declaration enforces it.
Why use the `::cs_main` global reference here rather than `cs_main`?
I think for new code we prefer `::global`, unless the name of the global is prefixed with `g_...`, in which case `::g_...` and `g_...` are allowed.

Never mind, just saw the developer notes recommend this ("Combine annotations in function declarations with
  run-time asserts in function definitions").
